intro: Setaria gracilis f. radicans, commonly known as the creeping foxtail, is a variant of the foxtail millet species. It is a grassy plant characterized by its slender, wiry stems that often root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous short, bristly spikelets. It is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. Its rapid growth and ability to form dense mats make it both a weed and a potential forage plant.
